required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to examine the original breast tumor material to see how much of a metabolizing enzyme (CYP3A4) is present in tumor material. The researchers want to see if this is in any way associated with how the patient responded to docetaxel. They also want to examine the genes in the tumor that are responsible for the production of CYP metabolizing enzymes, to see if they are normal or if they have polymorphisms, or change compared to 'normal' CYP metabolizing enzymes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who participated on UMCC 9900/9901
- Living patients must give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- No tumor block tissue available

overall_official.affiliation: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

clinical_study.keyword: Patients who participated in UMCC 9900/9901 (Phase II Studies of Tailored-Dose Docetaxel in Metastatic Breast Cancer)
